issue.title: [C++] index_in / is_in missing support for timestamps with a time zone
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14112](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14112). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The index_in / is_in functions should only require the value type be equatable.  Timestamps with a time zone are equatable and therefore we should support these types.

Since we do support timestamps without a time zone I suspect this was an oversight and not a real limitation.
